data.title: This Is Love
data.text:
Episode 96: Hula with Teeth

Episode #96

2024-08-21 05:00:24

Download

One Saturday night in the 90s, Patrick Makuakāne and about 15 other hula dancers showed up to a club in San Francisco they called Old Dreamland.

Episode 95: Nurse BokHee

Episode #95

2024-08-07 05:00:24

Download

Nurse BokHee is in the background of every season of "Grey’s Anatomy." She’s become one of the show’s most beloved characters – but she's only had a few lines.

Episode 94: A Day at the Crematory

Episode #94

2024-07-24 05:00:01

Download

Gabrielle Gatto works in the crematorium at one of the most famous cemeteries in the country. Thanks to our friends at Finally! A Show for sharing her story with us.

Episode 93: Switched-On

Episode #93

2024-07-10 05:00:48

Download

The synthesizer was invented in the 1890s. But for people to really start using it, it took half a century, and a musician named Wendy Carlos.

Episode 92: To Know the Dark

Episode #92

2024-06-19 05:00:42

Download

The night sky is getting brighter almost everywhere in the world. We visit a place that is trying to stay dark.

Episode 91: You Can’t Promise to Love Forever

Episode #91

2024-06-05 05:00:43

Download

There’s a famous love song – called “The First Time Ever I Saw Your Face” – about folk singer Peggy Seeger. Peggy told us: “If you’ve never been in love before – uncontrollably in love – I advise you, for an easy life, stay away from it.”

Episode 90: The Most Romantic Place in Philadelphia

Episode #90

2024-05-15 05:00:18

Download

McGillin’s Olde Ale House is the oldest bar in Philadelphia, and it also claims to be the most romantic place in the city. The Philadelphia Inquirer says: “McGillin’s has matchmaking magic.”

Episode 89: At the Drawing Board

Episode #89

2024-05-01 05:00:50

Download

Curtis was one of the first nationally-syndicated comic strips with a mostly-Black cast of characters. Ray Billingsley has been drawing it for newspapers every day for the past 35 years.

Episode 88: I’m Alright

Episode #88

2024-04-17 05:00:45

Download

When comic Maria Bamford made her OkCupid profile with the username Hogbook, she says Scott Marvel Cassidy was one of the only people who contacted her. His username was Lazer Eyes.

Episode 87: A Family Secret

Episode #87

2024-04-03 05:00:56

Download

When Kyo Maclear took a DNA test, the kit came with a piece of paper with terms and conditions that read, “You may discover unanticipated facts about yourself or your family when using our services that you may not have the ability to change.”

Episode 86: Charlotte as Romeo

Episode #86

2024-03-20 05:00:03

Download

When Charlotte Cushman arrived in England, she was heartbroken. But she began looking for work as an actor. There was one part she really wanted: Romeo.

Episode 85: One in a Million

Episode #85

2024-03-06 05:00:08

Download

A story about moving at your own pace.

Episode 84: The Nicholas Effect

Episode #84

2024-02-21 05:00:38

Download

If you visit Italy, you might come across a street, or a park, or a school, or even a chain of coffee shops named after a 7-year-old American named Nicholas Green. This is the reason why.

Episode 83: Albert and Alberta

Episode #83

2024-02-07 05:00:21

Download

One day, as a student at the University of Florida, Kourtney LaPlant was reading the student newspaper. “And there was this little tiny ad in the paper about, hey, we’re looking for new mascots. And I was like, why not?”

Episode 82: The Care and Keeping of You

Episode #82

2024-01-24 05:00:59

Download

When Valorie Lee Schaefer was asked to write a book about puberty for kids, her first thought was, “Why me?”

Episode 81: Tau = 10.8

Episode #81

2024-01-10 05:00:10

Download

When twin rovers landed on Mars twenty years ago, they were only supposed to last 90 Martian days. But years passed, and engineers were still trying to keep them alive. “We got very attached.”
